result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th) and Operating w/ PAC (4th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Ryan A. Scheel was found guilty of Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Ryan A. Scheel was found guilty of OWI (4th), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: on any vehicle owned and/or operated by Defendant.

Defendant shall undergo an AODA Assessment and follow through with any recommendations resulting therefrom.  Defendant shall successfully attend an OWI Victim Impact Panel within 120 days of conviction.

miscConds.notes: Shall pay fine and costs including the costs in count 1 to the Dodge County Clerk of Courts office at a rate of $125.17/mo commencing on or before 2/1/16 and the 1st of each month thereafter until paid in full

Shall not use or possess controlled substances without a legal prescription therefor;  Shall not use or possess drug paraphernalia;  Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle unless he has a valid Wisconsin driver's license.
Defendant must attend and comply with the terms of alcohol court.

timeConds.notes: Consecutive to: To sentence in count 1; Sentence shall commence on or before Court ordered start date;  with work release and transfer privileges

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.  Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.  and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.  Defendant shall have his/her fingerprints and photographs taken at the Dodge County Sheriff's Department, Jail Division.

10:40 - Defendant Ryan A. Scheel in court with attorney Jacquelyn L. Wolter.  Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested waiving time limits. Prelim set. Court sets bond at $5000 PA bond  with conditions:   Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.  Defendant shall not be in a motor vehicle operated by anyone under the influence of any intoxicant. Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle unless he has a valid Wisconsin driver's license.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 18, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Initial appearance on November 3, 2014 at 10:30 am.
